title: Use system topics for consistent behavior
tip: Customize the system Fallback topic instead of adding fallback logic to every topic.
why_it_matters: Reduces duplication and ensures consistent user experience.

title: Ctrl+/ toggles code view
tip: Press Ctrl+/ in the topic editor to switch between visual and YAML code view.
why_it_matters: Code view is faster for complex edits and copy-paste operations.

title: Use test chat debug mode
tip: In test chat, click the debug icon to see which topics triggered and variable values.
why_it_matters: Debug mode shows the agent's decision-making process.

title: Clone topics to save time
tip: Use Copy topic to clone a topic as starting point for similar flows.
why_it_matters: Faster than building from scratch. Ensures consistency.

title: Set up test accounts
tip: Create test user accounts with different roles to test auth scenarios.
why_it_matters: Real testing requires realistic user contexts.

title: Use Power Automate for complex logic
tip: When topic logic gets too complex, move it to Power Automate and call from MCS.
why_it_matters: Power Automate has more capabilities and is easier to debug.

title: Bookmark the YAML reference
tip: The YAML reference docs are essential for code view editing. Keep it handy.
why_it_matters: YAML syntax for MCS is specific. Reference saves trial and error.

title: Export and backup regularly
tip: Export agent as solution before major changes. It's your undo button.
why_it_matters: No built-in version history. Exports are your safety net.

title: Use Analytics to find gaps
tip: Check Analytics tab regularly. Unrecognized queries shows what users want that you're not providing.
why_it_matters: Real user data is gold for improving your agent.

title: Start simple, iterate
tip: Launch with focused scope. Add capabilities based on real user needs, not assumptions.
why_it_matters: Overscoped agents are harder to maintain and miss what users actually need.
